orig_descript: Where and how are the information and data gained that are needed to perform this job?
new_descript: Getting the info needed to do this job.

orig_title: Estimating the Quantifiable Characteristics of Products, Events, or Information
orig_descript: Estimating sizes, distances, and quantities; or determining time, costs, resources, or materials needed to perform a work activity.
new_descript: Find sizes, distances, and amounts. Find time, costs, or materials needed to do a task.

orig_descript: Observing, receiving, and otherwise obtaining information from all relevant sources.
new_descript: Get info in many ways. Ways include seeing, hearing, reading, and more. Info comes from many places.

orig_descript: Identifying information by categorizing, estimating, recognizing differences or similarities, and detecting changes in circumstances or events.
new_title: Learning about Things, Actions, and Events
new_descript: Put info into groups. Learn how things are alike or not alike. Find changes in actions or events.

orig_descript: Inspecting equipment, structures, or materials to identify the cause of errors or other problems or defects.
new_descript: Check things for problems. Test if they are working well. Look for mistakes, problems, or flaws.

orig_descript: Monitoring and reviewing information from materials, events, or the environment, to detect or assess problems.
new_descript: Watch and review workers, events, and tasks. Look for problems. Keep track of info.

orig_descript: What interactions with other persons or supervisory activities occur while performing this job?
new_descript: Working with other people and bosses on this job.

orig_descript: Providing personal assistance, medical attention, emotional support, or other personal care to others such as coworkers, customers, or patients.
new_descript: Help others with their needs feelings, thoughts, or health.

orig_descript: Identifying the developmental needs of others and coaching, mentoring, or otherwise helping others to improve their knowledge or skills.
new_descript: Find out what others need to help them grow and improve. Help them learn new things and improve their skills. Offer support.

orig_descript: Communicating with people outside the organization, representing the organization to customers, the public, government, and other external sources. This information can be exchanged in person, in writing, or by telephone or e-mail.
new_descript: Connect with people outside of your job. That includes clients, the public, the government, and more. Talk, write, call, or email clients.

orig_title: Communicating with Supervisors, Peers, or Subordinates
orig_descript: Providing information to supervisors, co-workers, and subordinates by telephone, in written form, e-mail, or in person.
new_descript: Give info to bosses and coworkers. Talk, write, call, or email people you work with.

orig_title: Coordinating the Work and Activities of Others
orig_descript: Getting members of a group to work together to accomplish tasks.
new_descript: Get members of a group to work together. Get them to do tasks.

orig_descript: Encouraging and building mutual trust, respect, and cooperation among team members.
new_descript: Build trust and respect among team members. Help them to work well as a group. Offer support.

orig_descript: Developing constructive and cooperative working relationships with others, and maintaining them over time.
new_descript: Build good working relationships with others. Keep those relationships strong over time.

orig_descript: Providing guidance and direction to subordinates, including setting performance standards and monitoring performance.
new_descript: Give other workers tasks to do. Set their work goals. Make sure they do their jobs well.

orig_title: Interpreting the Meaning of Information for Others
orig_descript: Translating or explaining what information means and how it can be used.
new_descript: Help others understand what info means. Explain how that info can be used.

orig_descript: Monitoring and controlling resources and overseeing the spending of money.
new_descript: Watch and control how money is spent and supplies are used.

orig_descript: Performing day-to-day administrative tasks such as maintaining information files and processing paperwork.
new_descript: Do daily office and business tasks. Keep files. Handle paperwork.

orig_title: Performing for or Working Directly with the Public
orig_descript: Performing for people or dealing directly with the public. This includes serving customers in restaurants and stores, and receiving clients or guests.
new_descript: Serve customers in many ways. Greet clients and guests.

orig_title: Provide Consultation and Advice to Others
orig_descript: Providing guidance and expert advice to management or other groups on technical, systems-, or process-related topics.
new_descript: Offer expert advice to others. Explain how to do tasks. Explain how systems work.

orig_title: Resolving Conflicts and Negotiating with Others
orig_descript: Handling complaints, settling disputes, and resolving grievances and conflicts, or otherwise negotiating with others.
new_descript: Solve conflicts and problems. Handle complaints. Help people reach an agreement.

orig_descript: Convincing others to buy merchandise/goods or to otherwise change their minds or actions.
new_descript: Make someone else want to buy something. Change people’s minds. Make people act in a way you want.

orig_descript: Recruiting, interviewing, selecting, hiring, and promoting employees in an organization.
new_descript: Find workers to fill jobs. Learn if someone is a good fit for a job. Hire workers.

orig_descript: Identifying the educational needs of others, developing formal educational or training programs or classes, and teaching or instructing others.
new_descript: Learn what others need to know. Teach or train them. Run classes or training programs.

orig_descript: What processing, planning, problem-solving, decision-making, and innovating activities are performed with job-relevant information?
new_descript: Thinking skills needed to do this job.

orig_descript: Identifying the underlying principles, reasons, or facts of information by breaking down information or data into separate parts.
new_descript: Learn the reasons and facts behind info. Break down info into smaller parts.

orig_descript: Establishing long-range objectives and specifying the strategies and actions to achieve them.
new_descript: Set long-term goals. Think of ways to reach those goals.

orig_title: Evaluating Information to Determine Compliance with Standards
orig_descript: Using relevant information and individual judgment to determine whether events or processes comply with laws, regulations, or standards.
new_descript: Judge whether laws and rules are being followed.

orig_title: Judging the Qualities of Things, Services, or People
orig_descript: Assessing the value, importance, or quality of things or people.
new_descript: Learn what something or someone is worth. Judge if something is important. Learn what skills someone has.

orig_descript: Analyzing information and evaluating results to choose the best solution and solve problems.
new_descript: Choose the best way to solve a problem. Study info and judge results.

orig_descript: Developing specific goals and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish your work.
new_descript: Set goals and make plans to get work done. Put steps and goals in order.

orig_descript: Compiling, coding, categorizing, calculating, tabulating, auditing, or verifying information or data.
new_descript: Collect, check, and clean info. Use codes. Do math.

orig_descript: Scheduling events, programs, and activities, as well as the work of others.
new_descript: Set dates for events. Plan when tasks will be done. Set work hours for others.

orig_descript: Developing, designing, or creating new applications, ideas, relationships, systems, or products, including artistic contributions.
new_descript: Think up new ways to do tasks. Use art skills. Make things. Come up with ideas.

orig_descript: Keeping up-to-date technically and applying new knowledge to your job.
new_descript: Stay up-to-date with the latest info. Use new info to do your job.

orig_descript: What physical activities are performed, what equipment and vehicles are operated/controlled, and what complex/technical activities are accomplished as job outputs?
new_descript: Physical work needed to do this job. Equipment used. Skilled work done on the job.

orig_descript: Using either control mechanisms or direct physical activity to operate machines or processes (not including computers or vehicles).
new_descript: Use machines or tell other workers how to use machines. This does not include computers or vehicles.

orig_descript: Entering, transcribing, recording, storing, or maintaining information in written or electronic/magnetic form.
new_descript: Enter, write, copy, or store info. Keep files and records. Some records are written. Other records need a computer.

orig_title: Drafting, Laying Out, and Specifying Technical Devices, Parts, and Equipment
orig_descript: Providing documentation, detailed instructions, drawings, or specifications to tell others about how devices, parts, equipment, or structures are to be fabricated, constructed, assembled, modified, maintained, or used.
new_title: Explaining How to Use Parts and Equipment
new_descript: Explain to others how to use machines, parts, and equipment. Offer written details or drawings. Explain how to build or make something the right way.

orig_descript: Using hands and arms in handling, installing, positioning, and moving materials, and manipulating things.
new_descript: Use your hands and arms to move things. Put things in the right place. Set things up.

orig_descript: Using computers and computer systems (including hardware and software) to program, write software, set up functions, enter data, or process information.
new_descript: Enter info into computers. Use or set up hardware and software. Program or write code.

orig_title: Operating Vehicles, Mechanized Devices, or Equipment
orig_descript: Running, maneuvering, navigating, or driving vehicles or mechanized equipment, such as forklifts, passenger vehicles, aircraft, or water craft.
new_descript: Use, steer, and drive vehicles. That includes cars, trucks, buses, forklifts, aircraft, and more.

orig_descript: Performing physical activities that require considerable use of your arms and legs and moving your whole body, such as climbing, lifting, balancing, walking, stooping, and handling of materials.
new_descript: Use your arms and legs to do work. Move your whole body. Climb, lift, walk, bend, and more.

orig_descript: Servicing, repairing, calibrating, regulating, fine-tuning, or testing machines, devices, and equipment that operate primarily on the basis of electrical or electronic (not mechanical) principles.
new_descript: Fix and test electronics. Make sure equipment is working well. Change settings to make machines work better.

orig_descript: Servicing, repairing, adjusting, and testing machines, devices, moving parts, and equipment that operate primarily on the basis of mechanical (not electronic) principles.
new_descript: Fix and test mechanical equipment. Make sure it is working well. Change settings to make it work better.
